text: "My favorite place in Hoboken hands down.\nThe portions are HUGE and the prices are low. 6.75 for lunch special with a huge soup

a black tea bag and a fortune cookie. That's enough for 2 of me.

a soup AND a salad. You can't beat that.
My humble opinion anyways

Oh and they have bubble tea and Thai iced tea . What else do you want?????"

text: 'The food was mediocre. I have never had sweet pad thai anywhere. The waitress said thai food is always sweet or the chef must have put more sugar.\n\nNobody came to take the check

column6:
and apple card they cannot charge tip. They forced us to pay 15% tip for horrible food.

Waitress is unable to explain dishes because they are not well versed with english. The service was slow. The food was average.

The front desk lady said this is America you have to tip.'

text: 'Listen. I‚Äôm not a hater. I‚Äôm really not. I‚Äôm a lifelong Hoboken resident

text: 'So my husband and I went there and we were sitting outdoors.I ordered a sushi and Thai ice tea and my husband just ordered a soda but they said For Dine-in it should be minimum order 8$ or 9 $ per person and we don‚Äôt want anything more so we Opt out for Takeout..The sushi was okay and the Thai ice tea it wasn‚Äôt good..'

text:
"(Translated by Google) The best Chinese food I've ever had üëåüèº 100% recommended.

author: Lydia Santiago
text: 'This place is in Hoboken but I love to go there to eat..the staff is polite..the food is amazing.'

author: Sava Neskovic
text: 'Listen. I‚Äôm not a hater. I‚Äôm really not. I‚Äôm a lifelong Hoboken resident
column5: and I‚Äôve been eating at restaurants here my whole life - and I‚Äôve never left anyone a review
column6: good or bad.\n\nHowever
column7: after my experience today at Precious
column8: I felt like I had to share my review with the internet.\n\nAs I was eating my fried rice
column9: I found a huge chunk of plastic in my food (I‚Äôll try and attach a photo if I can). The waiter seemed hesitant to exchange for another one
column10: but after a minute of my persuasion she finally let up.\n\nThen she proceeded to try and charge me for all my food
column12: since I lost my appetite two bites into the plastic-infested rice. The waiter consistently denied me the refund I deserved
column13: and went on to insist that I pay over thirty bucks for two bites of food
column14: and a bite of plastic.\n\nAs someone who had plastic in my food
column15: the least I could ask for was a full refund. The internet says that the average settlement for a civil lawsuit regarding foreign food of restaurants is more than $100
column16: 000.\n\nAfter half an hour of waiting and arguing for a rightful refund
column17: I just barely prevailed and I was granted a refund.\n\nAdditional
column18: my friends were granted something called a ‚Äúservice fee‚Äù. It‚Äôs their covert way of charging for a 20% tip - and there‚Äôs no way to opt out of it.\n\nFolks
column19: don‚Äôt come to this restaurant. There are plenty of other great restaurants with Chinese/Japanese/Eastern Asian cuisine food. One‚Äôs that have a bare minimum of service
column20: and don‚Äôt have plastic in your food.\n\n1/10'

author: Simon Celiberti
text: 'Horrible service and plastic in food.'

author: Justine B
text: 'Fresh
column5: great tasting food. Good customer service'

text: 'Disgusting. Im not talking about how it tastes. Absolute garbage. Crooks.'

text: 'Love the food. Cant ever go wrong with lunch or dinner here! A MUST TRY'

text: 'Best chinese food around'

The beef is spot on tender and the spinach and bean sprouts are still nice üëç crunchy and fresh. ‚òÆÔ∏èüíôüòòthx Precious you never disappoint."

text: 'My favorite Chinese food in Hoboken! Food tastes very fresh and huge portions. I usually order delivery but went to sit outside one day and it was such a great experience. Now that I‚Äôm talking about it

text: 'Amazing Chinese food and super speedy service. Great for takeout or eating in. The Wonton Soup is phenomenal

text: "I absolutely love this restaurant. It is only Chinese restaurant in ALL of Hoboken I'll ever eat at. The staff of great and sho is the food EVERY SINGLE TIME."

text: 'Would never order from again. Placed an order on my girlfriends Grubhub account which didn‚Äôt come after an hour and a half of waiting. When I called for a status update the woman who picked up told me ‚Äúsorry we must have forgotten to put your order in‚Äù. Didn‚Äôt try to make it right other than have the manager call me

author: chris kay
text: 'Best Chinese food in Hoboken.Very consistant food and good service when u dine in .Owners are very warm and friendly as well.'

text: 'My mother ordered egg foo young and chicken wings. Both orders were burned beyond recognition. The egg was completely blackened and the wings were dry and hard. The food here is overpriced and I‚Äôm in shock that they would even deliver food that was burned this badly. Never ordering again!'

text: 'Grabbed some takeout from Precious for dinner.  Egg Rolls

author: Nicholas Romano
text: 'Thought this place was good until I found a pubic hair in my Lo mein With Shrimp.\nI called back the employee who took the order and she was kind enough to say that she would give another LoMein with shrimp on the house next time I ordered!!\nGot pics to prove it..my girlfriend and I are  so disgusted.'

author: mark r
text: 'Delicious food
column5:
friendly service.

We bypass them ALL to make our way to Precious!
Highly recommend their new Thai Basil Fried Rice!! (Beef in particular)'

author: Pooja Desai Patel
text: 'This was our go-to Chinese place when we lived in Hoboken. Now every time we are in town
column5: we always pick up from here. As vegetarians
column6: there are plenty of choices
column7: from veggie fried rice to lo mein to the amazing string beans. They also have soy-based chicken that is always a tasty option. The only complaint is the consistency of the hot an sour soup
column8: as sometimes it tends to be on the sour side. The service is kind and swift and they are usually willing to accommodate any special requests for dietary restrictions. So happy we found this place well over 6 years ago!'

author: Nettie WinWin
text: 'The server waited for us at the our table to make sure we tipped. I feel strongly it was because we were black. I was hurt and disappointed.'

text: 'We came here around 9:00pm

We‚Äôll definitely gonna come here and try more food üòã I totally recommend vegetable lo mein noodles üçù'

author: Agraj Sobti
text: "Did not get to try their food. Yelp and Google both say their closing time to be 11:00pm. So we took the outside table at 10:10 only for the waiter to come out and tell us that the restaurant will be closing in 10 minutes. He kept coming out again and again to confirm that we can finish our food before 10:30 so they could close the place. Would not say it's the waiter's fault. The owners should update their operation hours on both Google and Yelp as it can be very misleading for customers. Again
column5: I am not laying the blame in the waiter. He was just doing his job."

text: 'First
column5: the food is pretty good and the lunch specials are a good value. Been going here for at least 15 years. What brings the place down is the service
column6: especially the attitude of the older male waiter. Downright nasty to customers
column7: like he couldn‚Äôt be bothered to work. For this I gave him a $1 tip for a $15 order. Mind up
column8: he could be bother to refil the water glasses or bring the orders together. He chased me out of the restaurant to show me the gratituity and said ‚Äòthat‚Äôs all?‚Äô. What the hell did he expect.'

author: Michael
text: 'Horrible experience right now at this moment.\nAt 8:44pm. The delivery guy took over an hour to arrive. Didn‚Äôt even want to give back my change. Said to me DO YOU KNOW HOW LONG IT TOOK ME TO GET HERE!!! And ran away with a 10 dollar tip for rudeness.  This location is only 15 MINITES AWAY FROM ME.\nNever ordering here again!!!!'

text: "I have been going here for years and years. It's the best Chinese food I have ever had. I wish I lived in Hoboken just so I could be closer to this place. The staff are wonderful and friendly."

author: Sundeep MADichatti
text: 'Good place for lunch'

author: Arielle Aquinas
text: "Best crab rangoon I've ever had!"

author: Frances Jennings
text: 'There are few Chinese restaurants in Hoboken however this is the best in town.'

author: David Torres
text: 'Cheap and consistently good.'

author: Quentin Blue
text: 'I love ordering food from this restaurant
column5: it has to be the best in Hoboken hands down.. But the reason I gave them 1 star is because yesterday I ordered my meal to go
column6: but my girlfriend was in a long line in cold stones so I decided to come back in to eat. I walked up to the front corner and I let them know I would like to sit down and eat.  The guy looked me in my eyes and flat out told me NO! I was shocked
column7: I instantly looked behind me and seen numerous people eating
column8: so I got offended because I knew off the bat that it was because I was a young black man. I had to ask him "Why can\'t I sit down" his reply was
column9: because you have to tip the waiter..... so not only did he tell me I couldn\'t sit down but his reasoning was because I had to tip
column10: as If I didn\'t come on and just pay for a whole meal with out a problem... I\'m never spending my hard earned dollars in the restaurant again & it\'s a shame because they\'re really good. But I will not be treated any kind of way...'

author: Katie Welnhofer
text: 'Fast delivery service
column5: delicious food and a good price.'

author: Ashe
text: 'Attitude
column5: Attitude
column6: Attitude.  Careless staff
column8: if you care for honesty and humility
column9: this is not the place for you.  As a vegetarian
column11: we received a tofu dish with meat admixed. After several denials
column12: they replaced the dish but charged us full.  We left quietly without tipping
column13: and the owner came running after us reminding us that gratuity was not included
column14: and when he realized that it was our choice
column15: he practically pushed us out to prevent other customers from hearing our reasons. Walked us to the door. They were never sorry.'

author: Brigid Ryan
text: "The food is good but the wait is awful. I've ordered a few times in the last week and the food consistently takes upwards of an hour to arrive. The most recent time it took an hour and 40 minutes. The last two times the food has also arrived cold. The drivers are incredibly rude
column5: one guy bad mouthed me because I didn't leave a tip. I didn't give him a tip because he was so late
column6: the food was cold
column7: and despite telling the driver and the restaurant that the doorbell doesn't work and to please call he didn't call. Instead he stood in front of the wrong door ringing the bell."

author: Ryan Chen
text: 'I LOVE YOUR FOOD!!! SO DELICIOUS!!!'

author: Andrew Price
text: 'Best Chinese food in Hoboken!'

Great Vegan options.

author: Jose Lopez
text: 'Really great egg drop soup.  Their spare ribs are awesome.'

author: Judy Socialexpert
text: 'I have ordered many
column5: many times and the delivery is consistently fast and the food is good.   Just about to order again now.'

author: Xavier Rosario
text: "Food was too expensive. Got delivery but the delivery man couldn't even speak English therefore i had to run around looking for him. The food was also subpar. Never ordering again. Only pro was quick delivery."

author: Sam jackson
text: 'The Boss is an arrogant
column5: his last name is Huang. I have been going there for years and I do like the place
column6: however they have a policy that requires you to spend a minimum of $15 on your credit card even for take-out! Legally they cannot do this as the law states that the minimum charge can be no more than $10. I contacted the restaurant and was told that the boss (Huang ) said its his restaurant and he can do as he pleases. I called VISA and MasterCard and reported the incident and the restaurant is now being investigated for abusing the credit card laws. Please confront Precious restaurant and the owner and let them know you will boycott the restaurant if they do not reduce the minimum charge on credit card to the allowed amount of $10! Also let them know that you will be calling both Visa and MasterCard and filing a complaint against the restaurant
column7: and then please follow through and do file the complaint! We cannot let these arrogant owners get away with this. Please stand up for your rights ! There is strength in Unity! To contact VISA dial : 1-800-VISA-911
column8: to contact MasterCard dial: 1-800-MASTERCARD . please take action and fight for your consumer rights.\nRegards\nSam'

author: zhanglei ye
text: 'Best Chinese food in Hoboken'

author: Rajat Chopra
text: 'Love the food. The pad Thai and chicken dumplings are out of this world. Yummy.'

author: Bill Pond
text: 'Wonderful Chinese restaurant! My favorite in Hoboken.'

author: Cody Harris
text: 'There was no one else other then staff at the restraunt while we ate
column5: the food and service were OK till we got the check. The server became extremely rude when pointed out he gave us the wrong change.'

author: Will Nickley
text: "My wife and I order delivery from Precious at least once each month. Although they always seem a bit frantic on the phone
column5: our order arrives hot and quickly
column6: even on Friday night! (plus
column7: we're in JCHeights)\n\nThey definitely have the BEST vegetarian options I've EVER tried from any Chinese restaurant. Their Vegetarian House Duck Special is super
column8: and so is their Vegetarian General Tso's Chicken.\n\nHope you find something you love

author: Baldwin Torres
text: 'Food was great! Awesome rolls and main course! Service a bit disappointing my "Chinese Fried Rice" arrived minutes after the "Chicken Wings"\nOverall I still plan on going back.'

author: Wendy Leveron
text: "Love it....I'm from JC and drive to Hoboken to have some Good Chinese Food :)"

author: Matt Pesci
text: 'The best Chinese food in town. I lived in Hoboken for 3 years and have worked here for more then 5 and have tried them all. Precious has the best Chinese food by far and their Sushi can be among the best as well
column5: though some nights I would say it is just average. Delivery times were always quick and the food is not horribly overpriced. Service is decent when eating in as well
column6: at least for a Chinese restaurant.'

author: Lewis James
text: 'My favorite Chinese restaurant in town. The food is not greasy like normal chinese fast food
column5: and it has the best vegetarian selection around. My favorite dish is the veggie scallops.'

author: Natalie Flores
text: 'My favorite chinese restaurant in town. The food is not greasy like normal chinese fast food
column5: and it has the best vegetarian selection around. My favorite dish is the veggie scallops and the veggie house fried brown rice. I love that they have such creative vegetarian dishes and my meat eaters always empty their plates so I can vouch for that too. I love this place
column6: it is cheap
column8: fresh and byob. What more can you ask for.'
